title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement patilindrajeet.science@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to broomExtra
text: outlines propose change broomExtra. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to broomExtra
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. YES: edit roxygen comment .R file R/. : edit .Rd file man/.

title: Contributing to broomExtra
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reprex.

title: Contributing to broomExtra
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look Travis AppVeyor build status making changes. README contain badges continuous integration services used package. New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

text: Please note broomExtra project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with broomExtra
text: Thanks using broomExtra. filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible. Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site. Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed. right place, need file issue, please review “File issues” paragraph tidyverse contributing guidelines. Thanks help!

title: Authors and Citation
text: Indrajeet Patil. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.            @patilindrajeets

title: Authors and Citation
text: Patil (2022). broomExtra: Enhancements 'broom' 'easystats' Package Families. https://indrajeetpatil.github.io/broomExtra/, https://github.com/IndrajeetPatil/broomExtra.
code: @Manual{,   title = {broomExtra: Enhancements for 'broom' and 'easystats' Package Families},   author = {Indrajeet Patil},   year = {2022},   note = {https://indrajeetpatil.github.io/broomExtra/, https://github.com/IndrajeetPatil/broomExtra}, }

title: Enhancements for broom and easystats Package Families
text: goal broomExtra provide helper functions assist data analysis workflows involving regression analyses. goal combine functionality offered different set packages common syntax return tidy tibbles containing model parameters summaries. combines functionality broom {easystats} ecosystems, package following advantages underlying individual packages (see examples concrete instantiations benefits): Covers number regression models individual packages. possible compute, output tibbles contains p-value column. robust extraneous input arguments might sometimes cause problems underlying methods. Follows consistent tidymodels column-naming schema. Returns comprehensive model performance measure summary. want add support regression model, natural place contribute either broom parameters.

title: Enhancements for broom and easystats Package Families
text: broom-family packages ones return tidy summaries model parameters model performance. {easystats}-family packages also provide similar functions, specifically parameters performance. Sometimes broom packages might contain tidy/glance method given regression object, {easystats} packages vice versa. hybrid functions broomExtra make easy retrieve summaries appropriate method robustly: broom::tidy + parameters::model_parameters = broomExtra::tidy_parameters broom::glance + performance::model_performance = broomExtra::glance_performance Benefits using hybrid generics tidy_parameters return model summary either broomExtra::tidy parameters::model_parameters, get best worlds. functions robust won’t fail ... contains misspecified arguments. makes functions much easier work writing wrapper functions around broomExtra::tidy parameters::model_parameters.

title: Enhancements for broom and easystats Package Families
text: Currently, S3 methods mixed-effects model objects included broom.mixed package, rest object classes included broom package. means constantly need keep track class object (e.g., “merMod object, use broom.mixed::tidy()/broom.mixed::glance()/broom.mixed::augment(), polr object, use broom::tidy()/broom::glance()/broom::augment()”). Using generics broomExtra means longer worry , calling broomExtra::tidy()/broomExtra::glance()/broomExtra::augment() search appropriate method two packages return results.

title: Enhancements for broom and easystats Package Families
text: Let’s get tidy tibble back containing results various regression models.
code: set.seed(123) library(lme4) library(ordinal) library(broomExtra) library(dplyr)  ## mixed-effects models (`{broom.mixed}` will be used) lmm.mod <- lmer(Reaction ~ Days + (Days | Subject), sleepstudy) broomExtra::tidy(x = lmm.mod, effects = "fixed") #> # A tibble: 2 × 5 #>   effect term        estimate std.error statistic #>   <chr>  <chr>          <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 fixed  (Intercept)    251.       6.82     36.8  #> 2 fixed  Days            10.5      1.55      6.77  ## linear model (`{broom}` will be used) lm.mod <- lm(Reaction ~ Days, sleepstudy) broomExtra::tidy(lm.mod, conf.int = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   term        estimate std.error statistic  p.value conf.low conf.high #>   <chr>          <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 (Intercept)    251.       6.61     38.0  2.16e-87   238.       264.  #> 2 Days            10.5      1.24      8.45 9.89e-15     8.02      12.9  ## another example with `{broom}` ## cumulative Link Models clm.mod <- clm(rating ~ temp * contact, data = wine) broomExtra::tidy(x = clm.mod, exponentiate = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 7 × 6 #>   term                estimate std.error statistic  p.value coef.type #>   <chr>                  <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>     #> 1 1|2                    0.244     0.545    -2.59  9.66e- 3 intercept #> 2 2|3                    3.14      0.510     2.24  2.48e- 2 intercept #> 3 3|4                   29.3       0.638     5.29  1.21e- 7 intercept #> 4 4|5                  140.        0.751     6.58  4.66e-11 intercept #> 5 tempwarm              10.2       0.701     3.31  9.28e- 4 location  #> 6 contactyes             3.85      0.660     2.04  4.13e- 2 location  #> 7 tempwarm:contactyes    1.43      0.924     0.389 6.97e- 1 location  ## unsupported object (the function will return `NULL` in such cases) broomExtra::tidy(list(1, c("x", "y"))) #> NULL

title: Enhancements for broom and easystats Package Families
text: Getting tibble containing model summary performance measures.
code: set.seed(123) library(lme4) library(ordinal)  ## mixed-effects model lmm.mod <- lmer(Reaction ~ Days + (Days | Subject), sleepstudy) broomExtra::glance(lmm.mod) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>    nobs sigma logLik   AIC   BIC REMLcrit df.residual #>   <int> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>       <int> #> 1   180  25.6  -872. 1756. 1775.    1744.         174  ## linear model lm.mod <- lm(Reaction ~ Days, sleepstudy) broomExtra::glance(lm.mod) #> # A tibble: 1 × 12 #>   r.squared adj.r.squared sigma statistic  p.value    df logLik   AIC   BIC #>       <dbl>         <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     0.286         0.282  47.7      71.5 9.89e-15     1  -950. 1906. 1916. #>   deviance df.residual  nobs #>      <dbl>       <int> <int> #> 1  405252.         178   180  ## another example with `{broom}` ## cumulative Link Models clm.mod <- clm(rating ~ temp * contact, data = wine) broomExtra::glance(clm.mod) #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>     edf   AIC   BIC logLik   df.residual  nobs #>   <int> <dbl> <dbl> <logLik>       <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     7  187.  203. -86.4162          65    72  ## in case no glance method is available (`NULL` will be returned) broomExtra::glance(acf(lh, plot = FALSE)) #> NULL

title: Enhancements for broom and easystats Package Families
text: Getting tibble augmenting data information object.

title: Enhancements for broom and easystats Package Families
text: grouped variants generic functions (tidy, glance, augment) make easy execute analysis combinations grouping variable(s) dataframe. Currently, functions work methods depend data argument (e.g., stats::lm), functions don’t (e.g., stats::prop.test()).

title: Enhancements for broom and easystats Package Families
code: ## to speed up computation, let's use only 50% of the data set.seed(123) library(lme4) library(ggplot2) library(broomExtra)  ## linear model (tidy analysis across grouping combinations) grouped_tidy(   data = sample_frac(ggplot2::diamonds, size = 0.5),   grouping.vars = c(cut, color),   formula = price ~ carat - 1,   ..f = stats::lm,   na.action = na.omit,   tidy.args = list(quick = TRUE) ) #> # A tibble: 35 × 7 #>    cut   color term  estimate std.error statistic   p.value #>    <ord> <ord> <chr>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl> #>  1 Fair  D     carat    5246.     207.       25.3 4.45e- 41 #>  2 Fair  E     carat    4202.     158.       26.6 3.52e- 47 #>  3 Fair  F     carat    4877.     149.       32.7 1.68e- 71 #>  4 Fair  G     carat    4538.     152.       29.8 1.03e- 66 #>  5 Fair  H     carat    4620.     146.       31.6 7.68e- 66 #>  6 Fair  I     carat    3969.     136.       29.2 4.86e- 44 #>  7 Fair  J     carat    4024.     197.       20.4 4.80e- 27 #>  8 Good  D     carat    5207.     115.       45.4 2.66e-145 #>  9 Good  E     carat    5102.      91.9      55.5 2.50e-206 #> 10 Good  F     carat    5151.      92.4      55.8 1.76e-204 #> # … with 25 more rows  ## linear mixed effects model (tidy analysis across grouping combinations) grouped_tidy(   data = sample_frac(ggplot2::diamonds, size = 0.5),   grouping.vars = cut,   ..f = lme4::lmer,   formula = price ~ carat + (carat | color) - 1,   control = lme4::lmerControl(optimizer = "bobyqa"),   tidy.args = list(conf.int = TRUE, conf.level = 0.99) ) #> # A tibble: 25 × 9 #>    cut   effect   group    term                   estimate std.error statistic #>    <ord> <chr>    <chr>    <chr>                     <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl> #>  1 Fair  fixed    <NA>     carat                  3800.         228.      16.7 #>  2 Fair  ran_pars color    sd__(Intercept)        2158.          NA       NA   #>  3 Fair  ran_pars color    cor__(Intercept).carat   -0.975       NA       NA   #>  4 Fair  ran_pars color    sd__carat              2545.          NA       NA   #>  5 Fair  ran_pars Residual sd__Observation        1830.          NA       NA   #>  6 Good  fixed    <NA>     carat                  9217.         105.      87.6 #>  7 Good  ran_pars color    sd__(Intercept)        2686.          NA       NA   #>  8 Good  ran_pars color    cor__(Intercept).carat    0.998       NA       NA   #>  9 Good  ran_pars color    sd__carat              1609.          NA       NA   #> 10 Good  ran_pars Residual sd__Observation        1373.          NA       NA   #>    conf.low conf.high #>       <dbl>     <dbl> #>  1    3212.     4387. #>  2      NA        NA  #>  3      NA        NA  #>  4      NA        NA  #>  5      NA        NA  #>  6    8946.     9488. #>  7      NA        NA  #>  8      NA        NA  #>  9      NA        NA  #> 10      NA        NA  #> # … with 15 more rows

title: Enhancements for broom and easystats Package Families

title: Model performance summary dataframes using {broom} and {easystats} — glance_performance

title: Model performance summary dataframes using {broom} and {easystats} — glance_performance
code: set.seed(123) mod <- lm(mpg ~ wt + cyl, data = mtcars) broomExtra::glance_performance(mod) #> # A tibble: 1 × 13 #>   r.squared adj.r.squared sigma statistic  p.value    df loglik   aic   bic #>       <dbl>         <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     0.830         0.819  2.57      70.9 6.81e-12     2  -74.0  156.  162. #> # … with 4 more variables: deviance <dbl>, df.residual <int>, nobs <int>, #> #   rmse <dbl>

what: Tidy dataframes of model parameters using {broom} and {easystats} — tidy_parameters
title: Tidy dataframes of model parameters using {broom} and {easystats} — tidy_parameters
text: Computes parameters regression models.

title: Tidy dataframes of model parameters using {broom} and {easystats} — tidy_parameters
code: tidy_parameters(x, conf.int = TRUE, ...)

title: Tidy dataframes of model parameters using {broom} and {easystats} — tidy_parameters
text: x object converted tidy tibble::tibble(). conf.int Indicating whether include confidence interval tidied output (defaults TRUE). ... Additional arguments passed parameters::model_parameters() broom::tidy(), whichever method works. Note pay attention different naming conventions across packages. example, required confidence interval width specified using ci argument parameters::model_parameters, using conf.level broom::tidy.

title: Tidy dataframes of model parameters using {broom} and {easystats} — tidy_parameters
text: data frame indices related model's parameters.

title: Tidy dataframes of model parameters using {broom} and {easystats} — tidy_parameters
text: function attempt get details first using parameters::model_parameters(), fails, using broom::tidy().

title: Tidy dataframes of model parameters using {broom} and {easystats} — tidy_parameters

title: broomExtra 4.3.2
text: Fixes tests performance package update.

title: broomExtra 4.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-28 Fixes tests broom.mixed package update.

title: broomExtra 4.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-27 Bumps needed {easystats} package versions. rlang operators longer re-exported.

title: broomExtra 4.2.3
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-12 Removes NOTE LazyData CRAN’s daily checks.

title: broomExtra 4.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-02-21 Removes lifecycle Imports get rid NOTE CRAN daily checks.

title: broomExtra 4.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-02-19 tests longer skipped CRAN.

title: broomExtra 4.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-10-30 ... now passed individual methods glance_performance. Removes ipmisc dependencies.

title: broomExtra 4.0.6
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-14 Minor tweak documentation. easystats_to_tidy_names now reexported ipmisc.

title: broomExtra 4.0.5
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-02 comprehensive coverage terms easystats packages.

title: broomExtra 4.0.4
text: CRAN release: 2020-07-24 Adapts tests changes made parameters package.

title: broomExtra 4.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2020-06-19 Minor release fix NOTE produced new R-devel checks.

title: broomExtra 4.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-05-11 Minor changes made fix warnings caused dplyr 1.0.0. Retired vignette. Check respective packages see methods supported.

title: broomExtra 4.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-04-22 broom package actively maintained, become bottleneck development testing current package. , now tidy_parameters function defaults parameters::model_parameters uses broom packages doesn’t work. also benefits (#21).

title: broomExtra 3.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-04-11 Slight modification easystats_to_tidy_names cover naming patterns easystats packages. Minimum R version bumped 3.6.0. Relies ipmisc package re-exports.

title: broomExtra 2.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-03-17 glance_performance function now returns combined summary dataframe broom performance packages, available. done include unique performance measures performance package contains (e.g., Nagelkerke’s R2, Tjur’s R2, etc.). Thanks Sarah, package now hexsticker.

title: broomExtra 2.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-02-22 New functions make easy access tidy dataframes broom-family easystats-family packages following functions: tidy_parameters glance_performance. tidy method longer attempt convert entered objects tibble last resort converting model objects case tidiers failed reason.

title: broomExtra 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-01-07 Minor internal refactoring code.

title: broomExtra 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-12-17 Deprecated boot_ functions added nothing rsample.

title: broomExtra 0.0.6
text: CRAN release: 2019-10-26 Maintenance release make package compatible dplyr 0.8.4.

title: broomExtra 0.0.5
text: CRAN release: 2019-08-19 addition trying extract results using tidiers broom broom.mixed, broomExtra::tidy now also attempts convert entered object tibble dataframe. solely deal dataframes often encountered writing wrapper functions around tidy. Minor refactoring boot_ generic functions make compatible upcoming release tidyr. operators tidyverse added reexports.

title: broomExtra 0.0.4
text: CRAN release: 2019-06-25 Adds new functions bootstrapping: boot_tidy, boot_glance, boot_augment.

title: broomExtra 0.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2019-05-20 maintenance release make package compatible R 3.6.0.

title: broomExtra 0.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2019-04-03 maintenance release make package compatible dplyr     0.8.1.

title: broomExtra 0.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2019-03-13 Initial release.
